item.title: [Summary] (Theory, Evolution & Games) Separating Theory from Nonsense via Communication Norms, not Truth
item.description: Separating Theory from Nonsense via Communication Norms, not Truth. Artem Kaznatcheev. Theory, Evolution & Games. https://egtheory.wordpress.com/2018/09/08/theory-norms/. Sep 8, 2018. Brian Skinner - how to distinguish good theory from crackpottery Both theorists and crackpots share an irrational self-confidence A crackpot relies primarily on positive evidence Thinks hard about a problem, arrives at a theory that feels right, and then publicizes the result. A theorist incorporates negative evidence: Ponders hard about a problem, arrives at a theory that feels right and then proceeds to try to disprove that theory Takes time to understand competing theories and compare them against her own.

item.title: The Importance of Deep Work & The 30-Hour Method for Learning a New Skill [Azeria Labs]
item.description: The Importance of Deep Work & The 30-Hour Method for Learning a New Skill. Azeria Labs. https://azeria-labs.com/the-importance-of-deep-work-the-30-hour-method-for-learning-a-new-skill/. https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=17163251. 30 Hour Deep Work Tryout: Scan resources and pick the ones that seem most useful (5 hours) Set up the environment and define structured goals (3 hours) Work towards increasingly difficult goals set in step 2 (22 hours) Each session should be about 4 hours. It takes about 20min to get into the flow.

item.title: [Summary] (Syll) What is Ergodicity?
item.description: What is Ergodicity? Lars P. Syll. https://larspsyll.wordpress.com/2016/11/23/what-is-ergodicity-2/. Nov 23, 2016. A random process is ergodic if all of its statistics can be determined from a sample function of the process. That is, the ensemble averages equal the corresponding time averages with probability one. Role of Ergodicity in Human Inference A newspaper has previously printed some inaccurate information, therefore, the newspaper is going to publish inaccurate information in the future.

item.title: How to Read and Know [Paul Graham, Robert Heaton]
item.description: How to Read. Robert Heaton. https://robertheaton.com/2018/06/25/how-to-read/. https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=17424652. Jun 25, 2018. Know. Paul Graham. http://www.paulgraham.com/know.html. Dec 1, 2014. Choose your content. Some books [and articles] are not worth the effort. Information overload is one of my major obstacles to reading to know. There are so many pieces out there. I'm biased towards highly upvoted HN submissions. My RSS feeds ran out of control a while back - my queue has +400 pending articles :-/

item.title: The Age of the Essay [Paul Graham]
item.description: The Age of the Essay. Paul Graham. http://www.paulgraham.com/essay.html. Sep 1, 2004. The purpose of an essay is to figure something out. Ergo, you can't begin with a statement. Expressing ideas helps you form them. Writing something that others might read forces you to think well. Writing also helps me code better. When I have a nasty bug, it's easy to try out so many ideas such that you lose track of what you've learned.
